title: IDOL search may have performance issues when enabling the access filter in DashboardDefinition
content:
IDOL search may have the following performance issues when enabling the access filter in DashboardDefinition.

  1. In the result returned by the kubectl get po -n itsma-xxx command, the status of the saw-dah is 1/2.
  2. The saw-dah pod auto-restarts occasionally.
  3. The search function has poor performance.
  4. In the action.log file of saw-dah, more than 10% of the queries consist of RLAC-OWNED-BY-GROUP,RLAC-OWNED-BY-PERSON,LAST-UPDATED-BY-PERSON,RLAC-CREATED-BY-PERSON.

Cause

This issue occurs because fields with incorrectly defined indexes are used in specific search conditions. 

Solution

Perform the following steps as a workaround.

  1. Update the content.cfg file as follows on all saw-con and sawarc-con pods (including saw-con-a and sawarc-con-a).

    1. Search for [SetMatchFields].
    2. Search for the PropertyFieldCSVs definition that is closest to the search result in step a. Note that this definition must be within the [SetMatchFields] section.
    3. Append the following code to the end of the line that begins with PropertyFieldCSVs. 
      ,RLAC-OWNED-BY-GROUP,RLAC-OWNED-BY-PERSON,LAST-UPDATED-BY-PERSON,RLAC-CREATED-BY-PERSON

      See the following screenshot as an example:

  2. Restart all saw-con and sawarc-con pods (including saw-con-a and sawarc-con-a).

  3. Run the following command on all saw-con and sawarc-con pods (including saw-con-a and sawarc-con-a).

    kubectl exec ${POD_NAME} -n ${YOUR_ITSMA_NAMESPACE} -- curl -k https://localhost:1444/DREREGENERATE?FieldProcessingSection=SetMatchFields

    Note: Depending on the number of documents, this process regenerates some index fields and may take a few seconds or a few minutes.
